title: Controversial tennis star taunts Carlos Alcaraz in message to Emma Raducanu
description: Emma Raducanu was sent a message by a tennis star following her US Open link-up with Carlos Alcaraz.
content:
Controversial tennis star Danielle Collins taunted Carlos Alcaraz as she sent a message to 2021 US Open champion Emma Raducanu. Alcaraz and Raducanu joined forces in the US Open mixed doubles earlier this week but failed to get past the first hurdle as they were defeated by Jack Draper and Jessica Pegula in their opening match. The mixed doubles at Flushing Meadows was revamped this year to attract the biggest stars of the singles game, with the event even branded as an “exhibition” because of the changes. There was a prize pot of £740,000 up for grabs, with Sara Errani and Andrea Vavassori ultimately defending the title they won 12 months ago.

After Alcaraz and Raducanu has been dumped out of the tournament, the Briton took to Instagram and wrote: “Crazy!! @carlitosalcarazz. “Thank you partner, had so much fun.” Alcaraz, who won his only US Open singles title to date in 2022, replied: “Still waiting for those Spanish words. Thank you partner.” And Collins jumped in with a cheeky comment as she penned: “Way to carry the team Em!!!”

Collins also featured in the US Open mixed doubles alongside Christian Harrison, with the duo acting as late replacements for Katerina Siniakova and Jannik Sinner. Sinner withdrew from the tournament through illness hours before it got underway after retiring from the Cincinnati Open final while 5-0 down to Alcaraz in the opening set. Collins and Harrison won their opening match against Belinda Bencic and Alexander Zverev in New York to progress to the quarter-finals, where they overcame compatriots Taylor Townsend and Ben Shelton. But they were knocked out in the last-four by Errani and Vavassori as they lost 4-2, 4-2 to the eventual champions.

Collins, who is ranked at No. 59 in the world in singles, has proven to be a controversial figure at times and has clashed with the likes of Iga Swiatek and Maria Sakkari in the past. In January, she sarcastically cupped her ear and blew kisses to the Australian Open crowd after getting the better of home favourite Destanee Aiava in the second round. And after being booed by fans during her on-court interview, she exclaimed: “During the match I was like, while I’m out here I might as well take that big, fat paycheque. CoCo [Vandeweghe] and I love a good five-star vacation so part of that cheque is going to go towards that. So thank you guys, thanks for coming out here and supporting us tonight.”

keywords.name: his only US Open singles title

summary: Controversial tennis player Danielle Collins has taunted Carlos Alcaraz, the 2021 US Open champion, in a message posted on Instagram. The pair had been competing in the US Open mixed doubles but were defeated by Jack Draper and Jessica Pegula in their opening match. The mixed doubles at Flushing Meadows was revamped to attract the biggest stars of the singles game and a prize pot of £740,000 was also up for grabs. Collins also played in the mixed doubles alongside Christian Harrison, acting as late replacements for Katerina Siniakova and Jannik Sinner who had to withdraw due to illness.
shortSummary: Danielle Collins taunted Carlos Alcaraz and Emma Raducanu online after their mixed doubles loss at the US Open, sparking controversy and mixed doubles competition.

argos_summary: At the US Open, Danielle Collins taunted Carlos Alcaraz after the mixed‑doubles pair of Alcaraz and Emma Raducanu lost in the first round. Collins, who also competed with Christian Harrison, was later knocked out in the quarter‑finals by the eventual champions Sara Errani and Andrea Vavassori. The article also highlights Collins’ history of controversial on‑court remarks and her clashes with other top players.
